articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit 1313
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects KPA Unit 1313
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, inspected KPA Unit 1313 honored with the Title of O Jung Hup-led 7th Regiment.
					 He learned about the implementation of the last instructions given by leader Kim Jong Il while visiting the Hero Jo Yong Ho Company under the unit in December 2006.
					
					 Going round a training hall, he learned in detail about the situation of the new year combat and political drill.
					
					 He listened to the contents of lectures given at the political lectures and underscored the need to give an effective lecture to service personnel to suit their psychology and characteristic features.
					
					 He underlined the need to intensify the politico-ideological education among the service personnel so that they may be trained as indomitable vanguard fighters strong in faith and will.
					
					 He acquainted himself with the operation of the training hall of the unit.
					
					 If soldiers are to proactively conduct under any difficult conditions and circumstances, they should be well informed of the topography of the region where they should carry out their operational tasks and, to this end, they should undergo intensive training on the basis of concrete information on the enemy situation and steadily improve the training methods and programs, he said. 
					
					 After examining the operational plan documents, he indicated tasks and ways which would serve as guidelines for mapping them out to be realistic ones as required by an actual war.
					
					 Then he guided a gun-firing drill of commanding officers and company leaders and political instructors of the unit.
					
					 Stressing the need for the soldiers to become crackshots shooting down an enemy without fail with a bullet and make it part of their everyday life to conduct drills for aiming and triggering, he taught them secrets of hitting the bull's eye.
					
					 He went round the Hero Jo Jae Hyon Company under the unit and took warm care of the living of its soldiers as their parents would do.
					
					 He had a photo session with the service personnel of the company honored by 19 DPRK heroes and 11 winners of the National Reunification Prize after giving them a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle as gifts.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Ri Yong Gil, Kim Yong Chol, Choe Kui Hon and other commanding officers of the KPA.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Namibian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Namibian President
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Hage Geingob upon his election as president of Namibia at the general election held in the country.
					 The message said that the results of the recent general election are a proof of deep trust and expectation of the Namibian people for the president and the South West Africa People's Organizational Party.
					
					 Expressing belief that the long and traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in all fields, it wished the Namibian president success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of its people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Thai King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to Thai King
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Friday sent a congratulatory message to Bhumibol Adulyadej, king of Thailand, on his birthday and its national day.
					 The message wished the king good health and happiness and the Thai people steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Thai PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Thai PM
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Friday sent a message of greeting to Prayuth Chan-Ocha, prime minister of Thailand, on its national day.
					 Expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the prime minister great success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 On the same day DPRK Foreign Minster Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Tanasak Patimapragorn, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Thailand.

articles.title: Burundian President Praises DPRK
articles.content:
Burundian President Praises DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Myong Gyong Chol presented his credentials to Pierre Nkurunziza, president of Burundi, on Nov. 27.
					 The president said that the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung who selflessly supported and encouraged African countries are widely known among the Burundian people along with his august name.
					
					 The DPRK, a country with strong military muscle, all the people of which are united around their leader in single mind is an example to be followed by developing countries, he noted, and went on:
					
					 Burundi will have close cooperation with the DPRK in the international arena and develop friendly ties with it in various fields.
					
					 The Burundian government and people sincerely wish the Korean people bigger progress in the future, firmly convinced that they will certainly achieve a victory in the accomplishment of their just cause.

articles.title: Exhibition of Scientific Research Achievements Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Scientific Research Achievements Held
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of scientific research achievements took place from Dec. 2 to 5 to mark the 62nd founding anniversary of the State Academy of Sciences.
					 Presented there were more than 270 successes achieved by the scientists, technicians and teachers of the academy in their scientific researches and scientific and technical activities this year.
					
					 On display there were science and technology books published this year at different units.
					
					 The participants exchanged successes and experience.

articles.title: Successes Made in Agricultural Science and Technology Presented
articles.content:
Successes Made in Agricultural Science and Technology Presented
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition and presentation on successes made in the agricultural science and technology this year took place here from Dec. 3 to 5.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers of scientific research institutions and education institutions in the field of agriculture and officials from worksites. 
					
					 Presented there were grain crops and vegetables of high-yielding species, varieties of fertilizers based on nanotechnology, agricultural chemicals and scientific and technological data helpful to boosting the production of vegetables and livestock.
					
					 More than 120 data on scientific and technological successes were presented there.

articles.title: Natural Broad-Spectrum Antibiotic Developed
articles.content:
Natural Broad-Spectrum Antibiotic Developed
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Sci-tech Exchange Centre under the State Academy of Sciences of the DPRK has recently developed new natural broad-spectrum antibiotic.
					 The antibiotic, whose main composition is keratin, is a kind of natural low-molecular peptide compound and considered to be efficacious for respiratory and inflammatory diseases.
					
					 Its remedial value has been proved through clinical demonstrations at the Pyongyang Medical College Hospital of Kim Il Sung University, the Pyongyang Municipal People's Hospital No. 2 and other hospitals.
					
					 The antibiotic, consisted of over 10 essential microelements, has neither side effect nor any tolerance.
					
					 Kim Myong Ok, a researcher of the centre, told KCNA that she proved its medicinal effect and established a technical process for manufacturing it.

articles.title: Hungnam Industrial Development Zone to Be Built in DPRK
articles.content:
Hungnam Industrial Development Zone to Be Built in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Hungnam Industrial Development Zone will be built in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province of the DPRK.
					 The zone is to be engaged mainly in bonded processing, machine and equipment making and production of chemical goods, building-materials and medicines, according to an official concerned.
					
					 It is now drawing attention of foreign governments and investors for its favorable geographical conditions and economic foundations.
					
					 In around the area there are harbor and railway station, several power plants and the Songchon River as well as various industrial establishments, including Ryongsong Machine Complex, February 8 Vinalon Complex and Hamhung Wood Processing Factory.
					
					 The area is also favorable for tourism as it has Majon bathing beach and Majon Hotel.
					
					 A development area for the first stage is 2 square kilometers and the DPRK government plans to encourage various forms of development projects including joint venture between the country's relevant enterprises and foreign investors.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on True Colors of America as Cesspool of Crimes Disclosed by Ferguson Situation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on True Colors of America as Cesspool of Crimes Disclosed by Ferguson Situation
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Mass demonstrations in protest against the racist policy of the U.S. administration have lasted for several consecutive months with a white policeman's recent killing of a black young man as a momentum. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes in an article in this regard:
					
					 Such demonstrations are an eruption of the pent-up anger of broad masses of people at the deep-rooted racial discrimination in the American society.
					
					 The present conditions of the black in America are very miserable due to the discriminating racist policy.
					
					 Minority citizens fall victim to the crimes and to the prejudice of the judicial authorities in America.
					
					 It is almost impossible for minority citizens in America to get jobs and even if they manage to be employed, they are subject to discriminating treatment though they toil and moil.
					
					 This reality patently proves that the U.S. much talking about racial discrimination in the 21st century is nothing but a charade to hide its human rights abuses. 
					
					 It is quite natural for the world to censure the U.S. as the worst violator of human rights as it is completely disqualified to talk about human rights.
					
					 Many countries in the world are now ridiculing the U.S., noting that it is experiencing a hot agony of shame and has become a laughing stock of the world because of the policeman's killing of the innocent black in America.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Media Accused of Releasing Misinformation
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Media Accused of Releasing Misinformation
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Hwang Son, representative of the Forum for the Study of Politics Desired, on Dec. 1 made a strong protest against the conservative media engrossed in releasing misinformation, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 Recently, the puppet police took such fascist action against Hwang as booking her on charges of making speeches in support of the social system in the north in violation of the "Security Law".
					
					 When the police again conducted an investigation, charging her with her participation in the cultural event at Jogye Temple in Seoul on Nov. 19, Chosun Ilbo and other conservative media lost no chance to release misinformation slandering the event and its participants.
					
					 Hwang held a press conference before the Seoul Central District Prosecution Office at which she accused the conservative media of libeling progressive people with lies and misinformation.
					
					 She declared her will to file a complaint with the prosecution against the conservative media.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Unilateral Actions against Workers Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Unilateral Actions against Workers Slammed
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Tong Man, chairman of the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea, held a press conference on Nov. 2 in denunciation of the puppet authorities' misrule, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 He accused the "government" of talking about the issues related to the labor while trumpeting about the easing of dismissal conditions for regular jobs without the discussion with the labor circles every day.
					
					 If the regime unilaterally tramples down the labor circles and persists in its unilateral actions, the federation is left with no option but to launch all-out actions against it, he warned.

articles.title: Foot-and-Mouth Disease Breaks Out in S. Korea
articles.content:
Foot-and-Mouth Disease Breaks Out in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Foot-and-mouth disease has broken out in a pig farm in Jinchon, North Chungchong Province on Dec. 3, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The disease was confirmed through the medical examination of pigs on the farm.

articles.title: "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK Censured by Koreans in China
articles.content:
"Human Rights" Racket against DPRK Censured by Koreans in China 
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Liaoning Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Nov. 25 flailing the U.S. and its followers for kicking off the "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					 The anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" rammed by the U.S. through high-handed practices and pressure by instigating some countries of EU and Japan is a conspiratorial document making profound confusing of right and wrong, the statement said.
					
					 The U.S. and Japan have no qualifications to talk about someone's "human rights" because the former is killing innocent people by unleashing wars for aggression in different parts of the world and the latter is refusing to make an apology for imposing unspeakable pain on the Korean people in the past, it noted, and went on:
					
					 Overseas Koreans categorically reject the U.S. "human rights resolution" against the DPRK and will make every possible effort to build a thriving nation together with the people in the homeland. 
					
					 A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the Federation of Korean Young Nationals in China released a statement on Nov. 25 denouncing the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet group of traitors for their "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces co-sponsored the conspiratorial "human rights resolution" against the DPRK at the instigation of the U.S. and stooped to any infamy to cook it up, the statement said.
					
					 The statement bitterly condemned their act of proactively joining in the "human rights resolution", an unheard-of conspiratorial document aimed to stifle the DPRK, as a heinous politically motivated provocation against the DPRK, the socialist homeland, and a treacherous act of driving the inter-Korean relations into the uncontrollable phase.

articles.title: Koreans' Organization in Russia Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Koreans' Organization in Russia Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket 
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia made public a statement on November 25 in denunciation of the south Korean puppet authorities' noisy anti-DPRK "human rights" racket. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are frantically staging the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket, ridiculously "hailing" the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" which was rammed through the UN and asserting that it was "reflection of the concern of the international community."  They, at the same time, are crying out for passing the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly" and setting up the UN office on "human rights in the  north" in south Korea. 
					
					 This is touching off indignation of all Koreans as it is an intolerable insult and challenge to the fellow countrymen desirous of improving the north-south relations and peace on the Korean Peninsula, and revealing once again that the Park Geun Hye group is the most heinous confrontation maniac and a top-class colonial servant of the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 South Korea is nothing but tundra of human rights as many people commit suicide under the unpopular rule and its people should overlook all sorts of insults from the U.S. troops and their violation of human rights, while covering a stupendous amount of funds for the upkeep of U.S. forces in south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are busy kicking up the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket by taking to the international arena even such human scum as defectors from the north who fled it after committing crimes. Their goal is to weaken the might and hurt the dignity of the rapidly developing DPRK, justify the confrontation moves and tide over their ever-more serious crisis caused by the unpopular rule. 
					
					 No anti-DPRK "human rights" racket of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet group can ever halt the triumphant advance of the DPRK demonstrating its might thanks to Songun and single-minded unity. 
					
					 The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia strongly demands the south Korean authorities stop at once the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.

articles.title: Article Posted on Online Magazine of Russia
articles.content:
Article Posted on Online Magazine of Russia
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- An article titled "North Korea, the UN, and War Propaganda" was posted on the Russian online magazine "New Eastern Outlook" on Nov. 30, 2014. It was written by Christopher Black, an international criminal lawyer based in Toronto and a member of the Law Society of Upper Canada.
					 The full text of the article says:
					
					 The Western propaganda machine is being pushed to its limits and could burst under the pressure as the United States and its coalition of the criminal spew out one set of lies after another against the nations and peoples who refuse to kowtow. The US sponsored resolution to refer criminal action against the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) to the International Criminal Court based on a report by a UN Human Rights Council "Commission of Inquiry" is another product of this machine and one more example of the use of the United Nations organization as a crude instrument of the American attempt to manipulate and dominate the world.
					
					 The report itself is an amazing document, not only because it is entirely contrived, but also because the "crimes" which the Commissioners allege take place in the DRPK are exactly the conditions that exist inside the United States itself. The hypocrisy is stunning but no one can be surprised when we learn in paragraph 31 of the report that the "public hearings" held by the Commission were conducted with the help of the governments of the United States, Britain, Japan and south Korea, all enemies of the DPRK, who arranged, according to the Commission itself, all the logistics, venues, interpreters, technology, security, press services and, importantly, the "witnesses." Nor can we be surprised when we look at the three members of the Commission: the Australian, Michael Donald Kirby, the Serb, Sonja Biserko, and the Indonesian, Marzuki Darusman, each one of them linked to CIA front groups somewhere in their careers.
					
					 Darusman, who was the Special Rapporteur regarding the DPRK and whose initial report is the basis for the creation of the DPRK commission, is a well known friend of the US and opportunist who became a member of the Golkar party in Indonesia which, with CIA help, murdered, 500 000 communists and people linked to left or labour groups in 1965.
					
					 He is now listed as an advisor to the United States Indonesia Society (USINDO), a US government front group whose president is David Merrill, who was a senior official with the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), a well-known front of the CIA, in various Asian and eastern European countries, during the eighties and nineties, and was an American ambassador to Bangladesh.
					
					 Darusman is also a member of the Global Leadership Foundation, whose patrons include such unsavoury characters as George W. Bush and Lech Walesa. The Foundation is a syndicate of former western leaders that states it gives advice to world leaders on how to run their countries but does so secretly, outside democratic processes, and the knowledge of the people. Their slogan is "Helping Leaders Govern." Of course the citizens of the countries concerned think that it is the job of the people through their representatives to help their leaders govern but apparently that's not how it works. Chief Executive Officer, Sir Robert Fulton, a former general in the British Army, and, former Commandant of the British Royal Marines, heads the Foundation, which is incorporated in Switzerland but has its headquarters in London. Not surprisingly, its financing comes from companies such as Chevron, Barclays Bank, Goldman Sachs, Alcatel, BAE Systems, Exxon Mobile, the Ford Foundation, and many o
					
					 thers of the same stripe.
					
					 The second member of the Commission is Sonja Biserko, a detested figure in Serbia where she is regarded as a Nato Quisling of the worst type. She openly conspired with the US and Nato against President Milosevic in the nineties, advocated the bombing of her own country by Nato in 1999 and called for the kidnapping of Milosevic to the Nato tribunal at The Hague. She is a founder and director of the USAID funded Helsinki Human Rights Group linked to Human Rights Watch, another CIA front group. She is also a senior fellow at the United States Institute of Peace, an official agency of the American government the Board of which is appointed by the president of the United States with Congressional approval. Present members of the Board of Directors include Chuck Hagel and John Kerry.
					
					 Michael D. Kirby is an Australian judge who is a former president of the International Commission of Jurists, an organization created in West Berlin to investigate alleged human rights abuses in the German Soviet Zone which was funded by the CIA through the American Fund for Free Jurists and the Ford Foundation and its founders included the head of the CIA, Allen Dulles. The ICJ was created in opposition to the International Association of Democratic Lawyers, the IADL, an organization of leftist lawyers around the world of which the writer is a member. Kirby opposed the move to make Australia a republic in the nineties and was a founding member of Australians for Constitutional Monarchy that advocated the retention of the British monarchy in Australia.
					
					 All three were appointed by Ban Ki Moon, who has caused dismay at the United Nations because of his obstruction of anticorruption policies and attacks on the independence of the Office of Internal Oversight, the UN watchdog bureau, and because of his biased call for action in the Security Council against the DPRK during the Cheonan crisis of May 2010.  The Secretary-General is supposed to represent the views of the Security Council, but Ban tends to ignore Russia and China in favor of obedience to the US, Britain, and France which should come as no surprise when his candidacy for Secretary-General was championed by President Bush after years of senior diplomatic service in the US puppet governments in south Korea.
					
					 The absurdity of the document produced by the Commission becomes plain in the opening paragraphs. Paragraph 2 states:
					
					 "Among the violations to be investigated were those pertaining to the right to food, those associated with prison camps, torture and inhuman treatment, arbitrary detention, discrimination, freedom of expression, the right to life, freedom of movement, and enforced disappearances, including the form of abductions of nationals of other states."
					
					 Reading that one would think that the Commission was making inquiries into the conditions existing within the United States of America where a fifth of the population is reliant on food stamps to avoid starvation, where prisoners are used as forced labour for private businesses, where torture and inhumane treatment of common prisoners and prisoners of war is routine, where habeas corpus has been suspended and arbitrary detentions along with forced disappearances, through the euphemistically termed "rendition" programmes, of people all over the world is a routine practice, where freedom of expression for those disagreeing with US policies is severely limited, where the freedom of movement is restricted to countries approved by the government, where racial discrimination is rampant and where the right to life for many minority groups especially blacks, natives, Hispanics and the poor does not exist as police murders of members of those groups increase daily.
					
					 But of course the commissioners could not care less about human rights crimes against the people of the United States by the American regimes. Instead they succeed in showing themselves to be a politically motivated team of US agents who held show hearings and produced a politically driven report.
					
					 In paragraph 12 of the document they state that the DPRK issued a report of 167 pages on the human rights situation in the DPRK, on September 13, 2014, produced by the DPRK Association for Human Rights that refutes every one of the allegations made. Not surprisingly the DPRK slammed the UN report and stated that witness testimony was fabricated, a charge that should be seriously considered in light of the experience of this writer and other defence lawyers at the Nato-controlled Yugoslav and Rwanda tribunals where the fabrication of witness testimony by the US controlled prosecutors has been the preferred method of operation.
					
					 The report also states that "fear of reprisals…has limited the willingness of many … foreign visitors to the DPRK to share their knowledge and information with the Commission." This is a surprising statement since this writer was a member of a team of lawyers who, on behalf of the National Lawyers Guild of the United States, an organization affiliated with the IADL, made a visit to the DPRK in 2003. Our report on what we observed has been available on the NLG website.
					
					 And covers all aspects of Korean society. The Commission never bothered to read that report nor did they try to contact us for our views. Nor have they spoken to the 5 American Army officers we met at our hotel in Pyongyang, the day we arrived, all members of a remains recovery team whose mission was to locate the bodies of American soldiers killed in the Korean war and who were able to freely move around the country.
					
					 Once we got over our surprise that the first people we met in our hotel in this supposedly "isolated" country were American Army officers, we asked them what they thought of the country and conditions, since we had just arrived and did not know what to expect. We were surprised to hear an American Major say:
					
					"Look, don't quote me or use my name, but when we left Hawaii to come here we were told it was hell on earth, but we've been here for two years and nothing they told us was true. It's nice here and they treat us well. Everything we had heard in the western media, everything our superiors told us was complete and total bullshit."
					
					 This echoed a conversation we had with two Congolese diplomats whom we met on the way out of the country. We asked them to compare their experience and they stated they were shocked, that everything they had heard about North Korea, all the negative propaganda, was false. They added that it would be a dream for most Africans to have the life that people in North Korea have.
					
					 The conclusion to all this is that the Commission of Inquiry Report is just another exercise in US propaganda. This conclusion is reinforced by the Commission's call for the Security Council to refer the matter to the International Criminal Court when they know this cannot be done legally since a strict reading of the Statute of the ICC only permits the Security Council to refer matters concerning countries that are already parties to the Treaty of Rome and the DPRK is not a party to the Treaty. In the alternative they call for the creation of another one of the ad hoc tribunals whose role as propaganda tools for the US and its allies is now notorious. The single purpose of the report is to prepare the people of the west for war against the people of the DPRK by portraying their government as criminals, the same propaganda strategy the US has used against Yugoslavia, Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya, Syria, and now, as Obama tried to do at the G20 meeting in Australia, regarding the
					
					  attack on flight MH17, Russia.
					
					 Bitter experience shows that once the criminal label is attached the dogs of war are soon unleashed, so it was a welcome sign that, despite a heavy disinformation campaign, many nations rejected the resolution against the DPRK, including Russia and China. But, for all that, we must be alarmed and we must stay alert, because the principal propaganda target of this campaign is the domestic population of the Nato allies themselves so that they will support, or, at least, not resist, the next planned war.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Kuwait
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was brought out in booklet by the Kuwait Times.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), tells about the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and the noble career of leader Kim Jong Il dedicated to the country and its people.
					
					 It clarifies the important matters arising in applying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 A ceremony of releasing the work took place on November 26.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Praised by Kuwaiti Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Praised by Kuwaiti Personages
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of releasing "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism", a work of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, took place at the Kuwait Times on November 26.
					 The editor-in-chief of the Kuwait Times said at the ceremony:
					
					 HE Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" reflects his steadfast faith and will to build the DPRK into a rich and powerful country by fully carrying forward the idea and cause of HE Generalissimo Kim Jong Il. And it well shows that the leaders of the DPRK are the great statesmen and true patriots.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's exploits are shining more brightly thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The future of the DPRK is bright and rosy as it has another great leader.
					
					 I wish Kim Jong Un good health and successes in his work.
					
					 Javid Ahmad, administrative director of the Kuwait Times who doubles as chairman of the Kuwait Asian Journalist Association, said:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il is the great master of independent politics and the great Songun brilliant commander.
					
					 It was thanks to his patriotic devotion that the DPRK could turn into a powerful country.
					
					 Today HE Kim Jong Un carries on going along the road of patriotic devotion.
					
					 Under his guidance Korea will surely emerge a reunified thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Personages of Indonesia, Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Personages of Indonesia, Myanmar
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Personages of Indonesia and Myanmar issued statements on November 25 and 26 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Shapril Arsiyad, chairman of the Indonesian Federation of Transport Workers Unions, said that Kim Jong Il's is a precious life of a peerless statesman as he made tremendous contributions to the Korean revolution, the human cause of independence and global peace and security.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 At the most crucial time when the imperialists were steeped in high-handed and arbitrary practices, clamouring about "complete end of socialism", HE Kim Jong Il published "Socialism Is a Science" and other historic works to frustrate their anti-socialist moves and prove the validity of the socialist cause.
					
					 And with his unique Songun politics he turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological and military power any formidable enemy dare not provoke.
					
					 Though he passed away, his feats and august name will be kept in the mind of progressive mankind forever.
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il is a gifted thinker-theoretician and a distinguished leader as he formulated President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary idea as the integral system of idea, theory and method of Juche and reliably defended the DPRK from the imperialist allied forces' frantic moves and built it up as an invincible fortress of socialism based on single-minded unity under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Immortal are his extraordinary exploits that contributed to the sacred cause for happiness and prosperity of the Korean people and global peace and security.

articles.title: Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il to Be Held in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Memorial Service for Kim Jong Il to Be Held in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party, Socialist Party, Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and the People's League of Bangladesh made public a joint statement on Nov. 29 in support of the appeal made at the 16th international meeting of communist and workers' parties.
					 The statement said:
					
					 December 17 marks the third anniversary of demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 He is the great leader who dedicated his whole life to the development of the Workers' Party of Korea, happiness of the Korean people and the victorious advance of the cause of global independence.
					
					 He performed undying feats on behalf of the times and history by guiding the revolution and construction to victory for many years with his gifted wisdom, distinguished ideas and theories and rare leadership ability.
					
					 The participants in the 16th international meeting ardently called on all the communist and workers' parties and other progressive parties to honor in humble reverence the memory of Kim Jong Il, who made undying contributions to the accomplishment of the cause of global socialism and the human cause of independence, on the occasion of his demise anniversary.
					
					 We will organize memorial events in a big and significant way, reflecting the Bangladeshi people's deep yearning for him.

articles.title: Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included round-table talks sponsored by the Nakhodka City Branch of the Maritime Territorial Committee of the United Russia Party, a remembrance meeting by the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association and round-table talks and seminars by Indonesian companies including the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. on Nov. 30 and Dec. 1.
					
					 The secretary of the Regional Political Council of the Nakhodka City Branch said that Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the Korean people who made tireless efforts to provide the Korean people with prosperity and happiness and a defender of justice who firmly guaranteed the sovereignty of the country. The secretary went on:
					
					 His several visits to Russia tangibly contributed to the development of the Russia-DPRK relations. In particular, he paid deep attention to the development of economic cooperation with the far eastern region.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, noted in a speech:
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided a strong military deterrence by holding aloft the banner of the Songun revolution and thus protected the dignity and sovereignty of socialist Korea.
					
					 He was the veteran statesman recognized by the world who steered the struggle of the progressive people for advancing the cause of global independence.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers are keen on such foolish act as tarnishing the image of the DPRK after kicking off an unprecedented mad-cap "human rights" campaign against it.
					
					 However, the imperialists can never check the progressives' strong support and solidarity for the just struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Independent Politics Praised by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Independent Politics Praised by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Myanmar paper The New Age on Nov. 29 devoted two whole pages to articles under the headline "We pay humble reverence to HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people on Dec. 17, 2014, the third anniversary of his demise", illustrated with a portrait picturing his smiling image.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and Korea today" said:
					
					 He pursued the original Songun politics and performed feats to be recorded forever in history.
					
					 He increased the country's military capacity in every way with his energetic Songun leadership.
					
					 Under his leadership, the Korean People's Army has thoroughly prepared to be an elite unit of defending socialism and powerful forces equipped with offensive and defensive means strong enough to defeat any aggressors at a single stroke at any time. 
					
					 The Ethiopian paper Reporter on Nov. 29 carried an article titled "Kim Jong Il, the great master of independent politics" illustrated with the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il. It said that his political philosophy is the Juche idea recognized by the international community as the guiding idea of the cause of independence. 
					
					 A Bangladeshi paper on Nov. 17 in an article titled "Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism" said that the Korean people are full of faith and will to advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism indicated by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism

articles.title: Brazilian Denounces Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Brazilian Denounces Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
 Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, on Nov. 28 contributed a statement titled "Murderers who killed unarmed black men take issue with human rights situation in the DPRK at UN" to the newspaper Hora do Povo in denunciation of the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the U.S. and its followers. 
					 The U.S. and its followers railroaded the "human rights resolution" against socialist Korea by instigating some EU countries, Japan and other countries at the Third Committee of the 69th UN General Assembly, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 This "resolution" was based on the "report of the Commission of Inquiry" on the human rights situation in the DPRK, which was composed of false data provided by the south Korean puppet authorities without a single visit to the DPRK. 
					
					 The aim of the "report" is to tarnish the image of the DPRK and create among the international community hostility toward the DPRK which is preserving sovereignty of the nation and adhering to the independent foreign policy. 
					
					 The spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry in a statement declared that the adoption of the "resolution" was a political fraud, totally rejecting it. 
					
					 The U.S. has deployed its troops and nuclear weapons on the Korean Peninsula, a strategic vantage point, and its surrounding areas for implementing its domination over the world. 
					
					 It is also working hard not to recognize independent socialist Korea with the patriotic and brave people who are united out of the will to firmly defend the system chosen by themselves.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un inspecciona la unidad 1313 del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un inspecciona la unidad 1313 del EPC
Pyongyang, 5 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la unidad 1313 del EPC, galardonada con el titulo de Septimo Regimiento de O Jung Hup.
					El Mariscal averiguo el estado de materializacion de las instrucciones dadas por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien visito en noviembre de 2006 la compania de Heroe Jo Yong Ho adscrita a esa unidad.
					
					Recorriendo la sala de leccion y la de ejercicios, hizo conocimiento del estado del entrenamiento militar y politico del ano nuevo.
					
					En la ocasion, tras escuchar el contenido de la leccion politica, dijo que hace falta impartir la leccion conforme a la psicologia y caracteristicas de los militares.
					
					Subrayo la necesidad de intensificar la educacion ideo-politica entre los militares para que ellos se formen como indoblegables combatientes de vanguardia y los fuertes en la conviccion y voluntad como verde pino en el invierno y como gema blanca que no pierde su color aunque se rompa en pedazos y como bambu  que no se doblega su rectitud aun en el fuego.
					
					Reconocio el estado de entrenamiento y administracion de la unidad.
					
					Al senalar que los uniformados deben conocer al tanto de la zona de cumplimiento de sus deberes de operacion a fin de actuar activamente en cualesquier condiciones y circunstancias dificiles, les ordeno desarrollar con eficiencia los ejercicios con los datos detallados sobre el ejercito enemigo y mejorar sin cesar los metodos y contenidos de los ejercicios.
					
					El Comandante Supremo examino el plan operacional de la unidad.
					
					Al cabo de ver los documentos del plan operacional, presento las tareas y los metodos que serviran de guia en trazar el plan operacional mas practicable en la batalla.
					
					Luego, dirigio el entrenamiento de tiro de pistola de los comandantes de la unidad y los jefes y los instructores politicos de compania.
					
					Refirio que ante todo, los militares deben ser buenos tiradores capaces de aniquilar con una bala a un enemigo, para la cual deben acostumbrarse a los ejercicios de punteria y percusion sin hacer caso del tiempo y el lugar y enseno la maestria de tiro certero.
					
					Recorrio la compania de Heroe Jo Jae Hyon adscrita a la unidad, ocasion en la cual atendio con el sentimiento paternal la vida de los militares.
					
					Dio como recuerdo binoculos y fusil automatico a los militares de la unidad, de donde salieron 19 heroes de la Republica y 11 condecorados con el Premio Reunificacion de la Patria y se retrato con ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Ri Yong Gil, Kim Yong Chol, Choe Kwi Hon y otros comandantes del EPC.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Tailandia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Tailandia
Pyongyang, 5 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 5 un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Tailandia, Bhumibol Adulyadej, con motivo de su cumpleanos y el dia nacional de ese reino.
					En su misiva, el remitente deseo al destinatario buena salud y felicidad y al pueblo tailandes, el progreso y prosperidad continuos.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al  presidente de Namibia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al  presidente de Namibia
Pyongyang, 5 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 4 un mensaje de felicitacion a Hage Geingob, electo como presidente en las elecciones generales efectuadas en la Republica de Namibia.
					El remitente senala que el resultado de las presentes elecciones generales efectuadas en Namibia es el testimonio de la alta confianza y expectativa del pueblo namibio en el presidente y la Organizacion Popular de Africa Sudoccidental.
					
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises con larga historia se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas en varias esferas, hace votos por los exitos en las labores responsables del destinatario por la prosperidad del pais y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Presidente de Burundi se reune con nuevo embajador coreano
articles.content:
Presidente de Burundi se reune con nuevo embajador coreano
Pyongyang, 5 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Republica de Burundi, Pierre Nkurunziza, recibio el 27 de noviembre las cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en ese pais, Myong Kyong Chol.
					  En la ocasion el mandatario dijo que las hazanas de Su Excelencia Presidente Kim Il Sung, quien envio apoyo y solidaridad sinceros a los paises africanos, son bien conocidas por el pueblo burundiano junto con su nombre.
					
					  Prosiguio que Corea con fuerte capacidad militar, donde todo el pueblo esta unido monoliticamente en torno a su lider, es el modelo para los paises en vias de desarrollo.
					
					  Afirmo que Burundi colaborara estrechamente con Corea en los escenarios internacionales y desarrollara las relaciones de amistad con ella en varias ramas.
					
					  Anadio que el gobierno y el pueblo de Burundi estan convencidos que el pueblo coreano triunfara sin falta en el cumplimiento de su causa justa, y le desean de todo corazon mayor progreso en el futuro.

articles.title: Se construira zona de desarrollo industrial de Hungnam
articles.content:
Se construira zona de desarrollo industrial de Hungnam
Pyongyang, 5 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Se construira en la ciudad de Hamhung de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur de Corea una zona de desarrollo industrial con buena perspectiva.
					Segun un relacionado con esta labor, se realizara alli el comercio exportador de productos elaborados a base de materias primas y de productos semielaborados importados sin pagar arancel, la elaboracion de maquinas y equipos y la produccion de los articulos quimicos, materias de construccion y medicinas.
					
					Las favorables condiciones naturales y geograficas y la base economica de la zona atraen  atencion del gobierno y los inversores de varios paises.
					
					Por tener el puerto de Hungnam, la estacion de Hungnam, las centrales hidraulicas y el rio Songchon son muy favorables  en el transporte y la introduccion de los materiales y las condiciones de electricidad y aguas industriales.
					
					En particular, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong, el Complejo de Vinalon "8 de Febrero", el Complejo de Fertilizantes de Hungnam, la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Madera de Hamhung y otras fabricas aseguran los equipos y materias primas necesarias y los articulos de elaboracion a renta.
					
					Ademas, en la zona hay la playa Majon y el hotel Majon que facilitan fomentar el turismo.
					
					El area de primer desarrollo es de 2 kilometros cuadraros en que se impulsara las labores de desarrollo de diversos metodos inclusive la asociacion entre la empresa de Corea y los inversores de otros paises.
